content.introduction: This chapter introduces us to large numbers, their comparisons, and estimation. We learn about place value, face value, and how to read and write large numbers in Indian and International systems.

topics.title: Comparing Numbers
topics.description: Learning to compare large numbers using place value method. The number with more digits is greater, and if digits are same, we compare from leftmost digit.

topics.title: Large Numbers
topics.description: Understanding lakhs, crores, millions, and billions. Learning Indian and International number systems.

topics.title: Estimation and Rounding
topics.description: Rounding numbers to nearest tens, hundreds, or thousands to make calculations easier.

topics.title: Roman Numerals
topics.description: Understanding Roman numeral system using symbols I, V, X, L, C, D, M.

exercises: Write the greatest 5-digit number and smallest 6-digit number. Which is greater?
Round 79,865 to nearest thousand
Write in Roman numerals: 49, 99, 444
Estimate the sum: 5,290 + 17,986 + 8,150

content.introduction: Whole numbers include natural numbers and zero. This chapter covers properties of whole numbers, number line representation, and basic operations.

topics.title: Properties of Whole Numbers
topics.description: Understanding closure, commutativity, associativity, and identity properties.

topics.title: Number Line
topics.description: Representing whole numbers on a number line and understanding their positions.
examples: 0 is to the left of all natural numbers

topics.title: Predecessor and Successor
topics.description: Number before is predecessor, number after is successor.
examples: 0 has no predecessor in whole numbers

exercises: Find: (15 √ó 8) √ó 5 using associative property
What is the predecessor of the smallest 4-digit number?
Verify commutativity for: 23 + 45 and 45 + 23
Show that 0 is the additive identity
Find the product using distributive property: 105 √ó 6

content.introduction: Learning about factors, multiples, prime and composite numbers, divisibility rules, HCF and LCM.

topics.title: Factors and Multiples
topics.description: Factors divide a number completely, multiples are obtained by multiplying.
examples: 1 is a factor of every number

topics.title: Prime and Composite Numbers
topics.description: Prime numbers have exactly two factors (1 and itself). Composite have more than two factors.
examples: 2 is the only even prime number

topics.title: Divisibility Tests
topics.description: Rules to check if a number is divisible by 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11.
examples: Divisible by 2: Last digit is 0, 2, 4, 6, or 8
Divisible by 3: Sum of digits divisible by 3
Divisible by 5: Last digit is 0 or 5

topics.title: HCF and LCM
topics.description: Highest Common Factor and Lowest Common Multiple of numbers.

exercises: Find all prime numbers between 1 and 50
Check divisibility of 5,785 by 3, 5, and 9
Find HCF and LCM of 24 and 36
Express 84 as product of prime factors
What is the smallest number divisible by 2, 3, and 5?

content.introduction: Introduction to points, lines, line segments, rays, angles, triangles, and other geometric shapes.

topics.title: Points and Lines
topics.description: A point has no dimension, a line extends infinitely in both directions.
examples: Infinite points lie on a line

topics.title: Line Segment and Ray
topics.description: Line segment has two endpoints, ray has one endpoint and extends infinitely in one direction.
examples: Ray AB starts at A and goes through B: A‚Ä¢‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Üí
Length can be measured for line segments only

topics.title: Angles
topics.description: Formed by two rays with common endpoint (vertex).

topics.title: Triangles
topics.description: Closed figure with three sides and three angles.

exercises: How many line segments can be drawn through two points?
Name three rays in the figure (provide a figure)
Measure and classify the angles in a given triangle
Draw an obtuse angle and label it
How many diagonals does a pentagon have?

content.introduction: Study of 2D and 3D shapes, their properties, measurements, and classifications.

topics.title: 2D Shapes
topics.description: Flat shapes with length and breadth only - circles, triangles, squares, rectangles.
examples: Circle: All points equidistant from center
Rectangle: Opposite sides equal, 4 right angles

topics.title: 3D Shapes
topics.description: Solid shapes with length, breadth, and height.

topics.title: Measuring Angles
topics.description: Using protractor to measure angles in degrees.
examples: Place center of protractor at vertex
Read where other ray crosses the scale

exercises: Identify faces, edges, and vertices of a cube
Measure angles: 45¬∞, 90¬∞, 135¬∞ using protractor
Classify triangles based on given angles
Name 5 objects around you shaped like a cylinder
Draw a pentagon and measure its angles

content.introduction: Integers include positive numbers, negative numbers, and zero. Used to represent opposite situations like profit-loss, above-below sea level.

topics.title: Understanding Integers
topics.description: Numbers with + or - signs representing opposite directions or values.

topics.title: Number Line for Integers
topics.description: Negative numbers on left of zero, positive on right.

topics.title: Operations on Integers
topics.description: Adding and subtracting integers using number line and rules.

topics.title: Comparing Integers
topics.description: Positive numbers > 0, negative numbers < 0, larger negative is smaller.
examples: Between -10 and +10, +10 is greatest, -10 is smallest

exercises: Arrange in ascending order: -5, 0, 3, -8, 7, -1
Subtract: (-7) - (-12)
A submarine is at -250m. It rises 100m. What is its new position?
Find the sum of all integers from -5 to +5

content.introduction: Understanding parts of a whole, types of fractions, and operations on fractions.

topics.title: Types of Fractions
topics.description: Proper, improper, mixed fractions, and equivalent fractions.

topics.title: Simplifying Fractions
topics.description: Reducing fractions to lowest terms by dividing by HCF.

topics.title: Addition and Subtraction
topics.description: For same denominators: add/subtract numerators. For different: find LCM.

topics.title: Multiplication and Division
topics.description: Multiply numerators and denominators. For division, multiply by reciprocal.

exercises: Convert to mixed fraction: 17/5
Find three equivalent fractions of 2/3
Simplify: 18/24
Divide: 4/5 √∑ 2/3

content.introduction: Decimal numbers represent parts of a whole using place value system with decimal point.

topics.title: Understanding Decimals
topics.description: Tenths, hundredths, thousandths place values after decimal point.

topics.title: Comparing Decimals
topics.description: Compare whole number parts first, then decimal parts.

topics.title: Operations on Decimals
topics.description: Adding, subtracting, multiplying, and dividing decimals.

exercises: Convert to decimals: 3/5, 7/20, 11/25
Arrange in descending order: 2.5, 2.05, 2.55, 2.005
Multiply: 3.6 √ó 2.5
A rope is 5.5m long. 2.3m is cut off. What length remains?

content.introduction: Collection, organization, and interpretation of data using tables, pictographs, and bar graphs.

topics.title: Recording Data
topics.description: Using tally marks and frequency tables to organize data.
examples: Frequency = Number of times an item occurs

topics.title: Pictographs
topics.description: Using pictures/symbols to represent data.

topics.title: Bar Graphs
topics.description: Using bars of uniform width to show data.

exercises: Make a frequency table for: A, B, A, C, B, A, A, C, B, A
Draw a pictograph for students in different classes
Create a bar graph for monthly rainfall data
Find the most and least frequent item from given data
Interpret data from a given bar graph

content.introduction: Measurement of perimeter and area of rectangles, squares, and triangles.

topics.title: Perimeter
topics.description: Total length of boundary of a closed figure.
examples: Triangle: P = sum of all three sides

topics.title: Area
topics.description: Space occupied by a 2D shape, measured in square units.

topics.title: Units of Measurement
topics.description: Converting between different units.

exercises: Find perimeter of rectangle with l=15cm, b=8cm
Area of square with side 12m
A triangular park has base 50m and height 30m. Find area.
Convert 5 km to meters and centimeters
A wire of length 40cm forms a square. Find area.

content.introduction: Introduction to variables, expressions, and simple equations.

topics.title: Variables
topics.description: Letters representing unknown values that can change.
examples: x, y, z, a, b, c
If age = x, then after 5 years = x + 5
If cost per item = y, then 10 items = 10y

topics.title: Expressions
topics.description: Combinations of variables, constants, and operations.

topics.title: Like and Unlike Terms
topics.description: Terms with same variables are like terms.

topics.title: Simple Equations
topics.description: Statements of equality with variables.

exercises: Simplify: 7x + 3x - 2x
If x = 4, find the value of 3x + 5
Solve: x + 7 = 15
Write expression: 5 more than twice a number
Combine like terms: 4a + 3b - 2a + 5b

content.introduction: Comparing quantities using ratios and understanding proportions.

topics.title: Ratio
topics.description: Comparison of two quantities of same kind.

topics.title: Proportion
topics.description: Equality of two ratios.

topics.title: Unitary Method
topics.description: Finding value of single unit first.

exercises: Express in simplest form: 18:24
Check if 3:4 and 12:16 are in proportion
Find x if 5:x = 15:12
12 books cost ‚Çπ480. Find cost of 18 books.
Divide ‚Çπ500 in ratio 2:3

content.introduction: Understanding lines of symmetry and symmetrical shapes.

topics.title: Line Symmetry
topics.description: A shape has line symmetry if it can be folded along a line so both halves match.

topics.title: Symmetrical Figures
topics.description: Shapes that look the same after reflection.
examples: Letters with symmetry: A, H, I, M, O, T, U, V, W, X, Y
Asymmetric letters: F, G, J, L, N, P, Q, R, S, Z

exercises: Draw all lines of symmetry for a regular hexagon
Identify symmetric letters in your name
Complete the symmetric figure given half
How many lines of symmetry does an equilateral triangle have?
Draw a shape with exactly 2 lines of symmetry

topics.title: Circle
topics.description: Drawing circles with given radius.
examples: Draw smooth arc completing the circle

topics.title: Line Segments
topics.description: Drawing and measuring line segments.
examples: Mark two points and join with straight line
Perpendicular bisector divides segment equally at 90¬∞

topics.title: Angles
topics.description: Constructing angles using protractor and compass.
examples: 90¬∞ angle using set square or compass
Angle bisector divides angle into two equal parts

exercises: Draw a circle of radius 4 cm
Construct a line segment of length 7.5 cm
Draw a 60¬∞ angle using compass
Bisect a given angle of 80¬∞
